simplesect.para: Free software been called a programming methodology, a political movement, and lately a business strategy. It is all of these things, but it is something more as well: it is a culture. Culture means predictability. A programmer may travel far and wide in the open source world, encountering regional variations of custom and dialect, yet still feel basically on familiar ground at all times.

This is a culture by choice.
Therefore to operate successfully in it, you have to not only understand the culture, you have to understand why people choose to be in it.
You also have to be careful not to exoticize it or believe the myths, like some paradisical vacation island depicted on brochures. The NYT and NPR and whatnot may be running breathless articles and ads (mention that Novell ad), but that doesn't mean the myths are true. Segue into the myth-dispelling portion of the outline.
